pages.text: $(#C71585)$(l)【Moonlit Elegance】$()$(br2)“Blossoming like silk brocade, gazing at the heavens in the silent night.”$(br2)The herbaceous peony boasts large, layered petals resembling drifting clouds, often blooming deep within tranquil forests. Its petals emit a faint luminescence, shimmering with a soft silver glow under the moonlight. Ancient bards once likened it to the ‘Lantern of Dreams,’ believing that gazing upon its blossoms at night could reveal glimpses of the future.
Widely distributed across various forests, preferring rich, fertile soil. During the day, its buds remain slightly closed, only to unfurl at night as if drawing moonlight into its dreams.

Excerpt from *The Starlit Journal*$(br)“That night, I followed the faint glow through the dense woods until I reached a clearing where peonies bloomed. As I gently brushed the petals with my fingertips, the entire world became outlined in silver light... but in the next instant, a sharp pain pierced my chest.”

Peony petals are slow-brewed with cane sugar, resulting in a tea as clear as a mirror, with a subtle bittersweet taste. After drinking, one's vision seems to be draped in a veil of moonlight, making silhouettes stand out even in darkness.$(br2)$(#8B0000)But beware—gazing too long into the night may come at the cost of fleeting pain...$()
